alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 7:57PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN UNION COUNTY THROUGH 830 PM MDT... At 757 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Des Moines to 17 miles north of Clayton Lake State Park. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines and Moses. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 382 and 391. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
